reviews.review_msg: Very stand-offish to students, rolled her eyes at me when I tried to explain a point. Is not open to discussion at ALL despite saying she is. It is a very intimidating experience when you do try to talk to her outside of class. She wasn't clear about expectations and kept having to deal with the many questions as a result.
Truly amazing!! One of the most inspirational professors in health science and cares about the students!
Amazing professor, truly inspiring! Everyone should try to take atleast one course with him!

Julian is a very knowledgable professor. He goes off on a tangent sometimes, making it difficult to follow. Over all though he will clear anything up if you have any questions. He's approachable and goofy which is always nice in a professor.

Before this class, I was really excited about mental health and addictions.  Julian killed it.  He is so disorganized that it detracts from the quality of learning.  He changed his mind several times about how he was going to grade assignments.  Criteria for term paper wasn't clear. No final exam, so no use going to class after midterm!!
A nice guy and extremely knowledgeable in mental health.. but also extremely boring. He has a tendency to ramble and go off topic.

A genius in his field, and a fantastic teacher. HSCI students should try to take at least one course taught by Dr. Somers, he will challenge their beliefs on certain subjects and help them grow. The key to enjoying Dr. Somers is to enjoy the courseware as much as he does. A fantastic professor.

Stefanie is an overall good professor but it is clear that she is new to her position. She intentionally provides you with vague instructions for assignments and papers, but expects PhD level work in order to get assigned an A in the course. I consider myself to be an A-/A student but I found her difficult when grading for upper division courses

He is one of the best professors you can ask for. He cares about his students and is willing to make adjustments to help students be successful in his course. The lecture is quite dry, but all the information on the slides is the exam content. Clearly explained everything before moving onto the next topic. Highly recommend his class10000%

Dr. Small is probably one of the best profs in the department. Super nice and approachable. Lecture heavy but very easy to understand. He values students time and is honestly the most caring prof ever. Goes above and beyond to make sure that everything is clear and comfortable for students.

Will is the best, I would take every course with him if I could. He is so caring towards students and always happy to accommodate any needs if you ask. Lectures are all based off the readings, midterm and quizzes are easy to do good on if you review the lectures. Always nice to take a course with a prof who is passionate about the topic!

William is the best, please take a class with him and enjoy learning about a topic that is actually interesting and relevant to public health. He cares a lot for his students and is always trying to communicate with them. I have never had a prof who actually listens to students concerns and wants to make thing easy for them. He is truly a gem.

Will understands the struggle of a student balancing many courses and is very willing to extend deadlines. His course covers 2(!!) textbooks so be prepared to read. He does a solid job of engaging the class in discussions. The main assessments are 2 papers with a limited page requirement so be succinct and dont ramble. Definitely would recommend.

Small is one of the most understanding professors Ive ever had. He is very accommodating, extending deadlines b/c we felt overwhelmed with our other classes. He values feedback and does his best to implement any changes. Class is very content heavy/lecture slides are dense. Midterms are papers. get ready to read. A lot. Group project involved.

Will is one of the most understanding and nicest professors I've ever had. His slides are very informative yet dense. He extended deadlines for assignments multiple times which I really appreciate. He really values feedback and always try to accommodate to students' needs. The papers are a pain but bearable. There is a group assignment so beware

Material is interesting, however it is easy to get lost as there is a ton of it covered. Group project can be a struggle depending on what group members you have. Everything is essay based so get ready to write.
